priorVersion.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--TESTCD

self.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

classVariables.definition: The standardized or dictionary-derived short sequence of characters used to represent the measurement, test, or examination.
classVariables.label: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam
classVariables.name: --TESTCD
classVariables.notes: Used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The short value can be up to 8 characters.

priorVersion.title: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

qualifiesVariables.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--TEST

self.title: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

classVariables.definition: The standardized or dictionary-derived name of the measurement, test, or examination.
classVariables.label: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam
classVariables.name: --TEST

qualifiesVariables.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--SBMRKS

classVariables.examples: Three unnamed sublineages of monocytes have been identified: CCR2+CD16-; CCR2-CD16+; and CCR2+CD16+. Whereas the entire monocyte cell population can be defined as CD14+ cells, the additional CCR2 and CD16 markers are used to differentiate one sublineage from another, none of which has yet been given a name by the scientific community. By combining the CPTEST value of "Monocyte Subset" with the value of "CCR2+CD16-" in CPSBMRKS, the full test is defined to be the CCR2+CD16- monocyte subpopulation.
classVariables.label: Sublineage Marker String
classVariables.name: --SBMRKS
classVariables.notes: Used to further subset the cell population identified in CPTEST based on the use of additional marker(s) that define a sublineage. The value in CPSBMRKS is used in combination with values in CPTEST and CPCELSTA to fully describe the cell population being measured. As such, it is an essential component of the full test name.

qualifiesVariables.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CELSTA

classVariables.label: Cell State
classVariables.name: --CELSTA
classVariables.notes: A textual description of a subset of the cell population identified in CPTEST based on a particular functional and/or biological state (e.g., primed, activated, proliferating, senescent, G2-arrested). When populated, the values in CPCELSTA and CPSMRKS, in combination with values in CPTEST and CPSBMRKS, fully describe the cell population being measured.

qualifiesVariables.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CSMRKS

classVariables.examples: When Ki67 expression is used to determine that a cell population is in a proliferating state (i.e., CPCELSTA value = "PROLIFERATING"), the value "Ki67+" in CPCSMRKS indicates that positive expression of Ki67 was used to define the population as proliferating. Similarly, a value of "Ki67-" in CPCSMRKS would indicate that lack of expression of Ki67 defined the "NON-PROLIFERATING" cell state in CPCELSTA. The CPCSMRKS value is useful for quickly determining which marker(s) were used to classify (i.e., operationally define) a cell population based on a functional/biological state.
classVariables.label: Cell State Marker String
classVariables.name: --CSMRKS
classVariables.notes: Identifies the marker(s) or indicator(s) used to define the cell state (i.e., the value in CPCELSTA).

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CNTMOD

classVariables.label: Contact Mode
classVariables.name: --CNTMOD
classVariables.notes: The way in which the measurement, test, or examination was conducted.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--EPCHGI

classVariables.label: Epi/Pandemic Related Change Indicator
classVariables.name: --EPCHGI
classVariables.notes: Indicates whether the measurement, test, or examination was changed due to an epidemic or pandemic.

qualifiesVariables.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--TSTCND

classVariables.examples: Stimulating or activating agents, assay temperature, incubation time \n "STIMULATED", "NON-STIMULATED", "25 C", "37 C".
classVariables.label: Test Condition
classVariables.name: --TSTCND
classVariables.notes: Identifies any planned condition imposed by the assay system on the specimen at the time the test is performed.
classVariables.usageRestrictions: CP, IS, and LB domains only

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CNDAGT

classVariables.examples: "Phorbol myristate acetate", "Concanavalin A, PHA-P", "TNF-alpha, Ionomycin", "Candida antigen"
classVariables.label: Test Condition Agent
classVariables.name: --CNDAGT
classVariables.notes: The textual description of the agent used to impose a test condition identified in CPTSTCND. For example, records might be produced for the same test run under stimulating (CPTSTCND value = "STIMULATED") conditions produced by different stimulating agents.
classVariables.usageRestrictions: CP, IS, and LB domains only

qualifiesVariables.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--BDAGNT

classVariables.label: Binding Agent
classVariables.name: --BDAGNT
classVariables.notes: The textual description of the agent that's binding to the entity in the --TEST variable. The --BDAGNT variable is used to indicate that there is a binding relationship between the entities in the --TEST and --BDAGNT variables, regardless of direction.--BDAGNT is not a method qualifier. It should only be used when the actual interest of the measurement is the binding interaction between the two entities in --TEST and --BDAGNT. In other words, the combination of --TEST and --BDAGNT should describe the thing, the entity, or the analyte being measured, without the need for additional variables. \n The binding agent may be, but is not limited to, a test article, a portion of the test article, a related compound, an endogenous molecule, an allergen, or an infectious agent.
classVariables.usageRestrictions: CP, IS, and LB domains only

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--ABCLID

classVariables.label: Antibody Clone Identifier
classVariables.name: --ABCLID
classVariables.notes: Identifies the antibody clone (e.g., supplier-provided catalog name) used to confer specificity for the binding agent specified in CPBDAGNT.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--MRKSTR

classVariables.label: Marker String
classVariables.name: --MRKSTR
classVariables.notes: The text string identifying the full set of markers/indicators used by the laboratory to operationally define the complete test. Because laboratories often use different markers/indicators to identify a cell population, the relationship between a named cell population in CPTEST (as combined with CPSBMRKS and CPCELSTA values) and the set of markers used to identify that population is many-to-one. To ensure nuances important for accurately interpreting the data are accounted for and which arise from the use of different sets of markers, it is necessary to operationally define the test in terms of the markers/indicators used to perform that test.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--GATE

classVariables.label: Gate
classVariables.name: --GATE
classVariables.notes: The sponsor-defined name assigned to a gate. Gates are electronic (device setting or software-defined) boundaries set by a user to virtually parse a specimen into discrete populations based on a set of defined characteristics (e.g., presence, absence, or intensity of expression of various markers; physical size; internal complexity or granularity). Gates are used to constrain data collection or analysis to a specific cell population or region of interest within the specimen.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--GATDEF

classVariables.label: Gate Definition
classVariables.name: --GATDEF
classVariables.notes: The text string identifying the set of parameters and the order in which they are applied to define the gating strategy. In practice, a series of 2-dimensional subgates based on 2 different cell characteristics (i.e., markers/indicators/physical properties) are most often combined until the cell population of interest is sufficiently resolved (i.e., electronically isolated) from other cell populations contained within the specimen. \n For complex analyses, differences in gating strategies can produce subtle differences in results obtained for a test. To ensure nuances important for accurately interpreting the data are accounted for and which arise from the use of different gating strategies, it is often necessary to qualify the test in terms of the gating strategy. For some purposes, however, and at the discretion of the sponsor, only the ultimate or penultimate gate is identified. When specifying the gating strategy in CPGATDEF, each subgate should be listed in the order it was applied and separated from the next sub-gate using the vertical line or pipe character ("|").

qualifiesVariables.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--TSTOPO

classVariables.label: Test Operational Objective
classVariables.name: --TSTOPO
classVariables.notes: The textual description of the high-level purpose of the test at the operational level.

qualifiesVariables.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--MSCBCE

classVariables.label: Molecule Secreted by Cells
classVariables.name: --MSCBCE
classVariables.notes: The textual description of the entity secreted by the cells represented in --TEST. The combination of --TEST and --MSBCE should describe the thing, the entity, or the analyte being measured, without the need for additional variables.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--AGENT

classVariables.label: Agent Name
classVariables.name: --AGENT
classVariables.notes: The name of the drug or other material for which resistance is tested. The agent may be used for in vitro testing or may be used in tests for genetic markers or in direct phenotypic drug-sensitivity testing.

qualifiesVariables.title: Agent Name

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CONC

classVariables.label: Agent Concentration
classVariables.name: --CONC
classVariables.notes: The amount of drug or other material listed in MSAGENT per unit volume or weight. Used when the agent is part of the prespecified test. Not to be used when the concentration is a result of a test such as minimal inhibitory concentration, IC50, or EC50.

qualifiesVariables.title: Agent Concentration

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CONCU

classVariables.label: Agent Concentration Units
classVariables.name: --CONCU
classVariables.notes: Unit of measure for MSCONC.

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--MODIFY

classVariables.definition: A value which represents an alteration to a collected value for coding purposes.
classVariables.label: Modified Result Term
classVariables.name: --MODIFY

qualifiesVariables.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--TSTDTL

classVariables.examples: STAINING INTENSITY when MITEST="Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor 2"
classVariables.label: Measurement, Test, or Examination Detail
classVariables.name: --TSTDTL
classVariables.notes: Further description of --TESTCD and --TEST.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--SPTSTD

classVariables.label: Sponsor Test Description
classVariables.name: --SPTSTD
classVariables.notes: Sponsor's description of a test. This variable is particularly valuable for identifying the cell population on which certain tests are conducted when it is not identified in the Test Name (CPTEST; e.g., tests for quantitative expression of a particular marker).

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CAT

classVariables.definition: A grouping or classification of the topic of the finding, event, or intervention.
classVariables.label: Category
classVariables.name: --CAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--SCAT

classVariables.definition: A further grouping or classification of the category for the topic of the finding, event, or intervention.
classVariables.label: Subcategory
classVariables.name: --SCAT
classVariables.notes: The category is in --CAT.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--TSTPNL

classVariables.label: Test Panel
classVariables.name: --TSTPNL
classVariables.notes: Sponsor-defined textual description used to group tests run together as part of a test panel. Can be used with --GRPID to ensure that relationships between associated tests are accurately identified.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--POS

classVariables.definition: The particular way that a subject's body is placed or situated during an assessment.
classVariables.label: Position of Subject During Observation
classVariables.name: --POS

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--BODSYS

classVariables.definition: A standardized or dictionary-derived name for the body system or organ class.
classVariables.label: Body System or Organ Class
classVariables.name: --BODSYS

priorVersion.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--ORRES

self.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

classVariables.definition: The result of the measurement, test, or examination, as originally received or collected.
classVariables.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
classVariables.name: --ORRES

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Original Units
Normal Range Lower Limit-Original Units
Normal Range Upper Limit-Original Units
Reference Result in Original Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--ORRESU

classVariables.definition: The unit of measure for the result (as originally received or collected) of the measurement, test, or examination.
classVariables.label: Original Units
classVariables.name: --ORRESU
classVariables.notes: Unit for --ORRES and --ORREF.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--RESSCL

classVariables.label: Result Scale
classVariables.name: --RESSCL
classVariables.notes: Classifies the scale of the original result value with respect to whether the result is, for example, ordinal, nominal, quantitative, or narrative.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--RESTYP

classVariables.label: Result Type
classVariables.name: --RESTYP
classVariables.notes: Classifies the kind of result (i.e., property type) originally reported for the test.

qualifiesVariables.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--COLSRT

classVariables.label: Collected Summary Result Type
classVariables.name: --COLSRT
classVariables.notes: Used to indicate the type of a collected summary result. This is used for summary results collected on a CRF or provided by an external vendor (e.g., central lab). \n If the summary result is derived by the sponsor using individual source data records, the summary result is represented in ADaM. If a sponsor has both a collected or vendor-provided summary result and a derived summary result, the collected or vendor-provided summary result is represented in SDTM and the derived summary result is represented in ADaM.

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--ORNRLO

classVariables.definition: The lowest value in a normal or reference range for the result (as originally received or collected) of the measurement, test, or examination.
classVariables.label: Normal Range Lower Limit-Original Units
classVariables.name: --ORNRLO

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--ORNRHI

classVariables.definition: The highest value in a normal or reference range for the result (as originally received or collected) of the measurement, test, or examination.
classVariables.label: Normal Range Upper Limit-Original Units
classVariables.name: --ORNRHI

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--ORREF

classVariables.examples: Value from predicted normal value in spirometry tests.
classVariables.label: Reference Result in Original Units
classVariables.name: --ORREF
classVariables.notes: Reference value for the result or finding as originally received or collected. --ORREF uses the same units as --ORRES, if applicable.

qualifiesVariables.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--LLOD

classVariables.label: Lower Limit of Detection
classVariables.name: --LLOD
classVariables.notes: The lowest threshold (as originally received or collected) for reliably detecting the presence or absence of substance measured by a specific test. The value for the field will be as described in documentation from the instrument or lab vendor.

priorVersion.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--STRESC

self.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

classVariables.definition: The standardized result of the measurement, test, or examination, in character format.
classVariables.examples: If various tests have results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in --ORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in --STRESC as "NEGATIVE".
classVariables.label: Result or Finding in Standard Format
classVariables.name: --STRESC
classVariables.notes: --STRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in --STRESN.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--IMPLBL

classVariables.label: Implantation Site Label
classVariables.name: --IMPLBL
classVariables.notes: Label or identifier that describes the location or position of a fetal implantation site in the uterus (or uterine horn) when classifying implantations during a uterine examination in a reproductive toxicology study.
classVariables.usageRestrictions: Not in human clinical trials; IC Domain only

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--STRESN

classVariables.definition: The standardized result of the measurement, test, or examination in numeric format.
classVariables.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
classVariables.name: --STRESN
classVariables.notes: Copied in numeric format from --STRESC. --STRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format
Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units

Normal Range Upper Limit-Standard Units

classVariables.name: --STRESU

Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units

classVariables.definition: The lowest value in a normal or reference range for the standardized result of the measurement, test, or examination.
classVariables.label: Normal Range Lower Limit-Standard Units
classVariables.name: --STNRLO

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format
Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--STNRHI

classVariables.definition: The highest value in a normal or reference range for the standardized result of the measurement, test, or examination.
classVariables.label: Normal Range Upper Limit-Standard Units
classVariables.name: --STNRHI

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--STNRC

classVariables.definition: A set of normal or reference values for the standardized character result, in an ordinal scale or categorical grouping.
classVariables.label: Normal Range for Character Results
classVariables.name: --STNRC

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--STREFC

classVariables.label: Reference Result in Standard Format
classVariables.name: --STREFC
classVariables.notes: Reference value for the result or finding copied or derived from --ORREF in a standard format.

priorVersion.title: Numeric Reference Result in Std Units

qualifiesVariables.title: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--STREFN

self.title: Numeric Reference Result in Std Units

classVariables.label: Numeric Reference Result in Std Units
classVariables.name: --STREFN
classVariables.notes: Reference value for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format or in standard units. --STREFN uses the same units as --STRESN, if applicable.

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Original Units
Result or Finding in Standard Format
Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--NRIND

classVariables.definition: A classification of the original or standardized result as it relates to a normal or reference result range.
classVariables.label: Normal/Reference Range Indicator
classVariables.name: --NRIND
classVariables.notes: May be defined by --ORNRLO and --ORNRHI or other objective criteria.

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Original Units
Result or Finding in Standard Format
Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--RESCAT

classVariables.definition: A grouping or classification of the results of an assessment.
classVariables.label: Result Category
classVariables.name: --RESCAT
classVariables.notes: The result is in --STRESC.

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Original Units
Result or Finding in Standard Format
Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--INHERT

classVariables.label: Inheritability
classVariables.name: --INHERT
classVariables.notes: Identifies whether the variation can be passed to the next generation.

qualifiesVariables.title: Method of Test or Examination

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--GENREF

classVariables.examples: For example, Genome Reference Consortium Human Build 38 patch release 13 may be represented as GRCh38.p13.

classVariables.notes: An identifier for the genome reference used to generate the reported result.

Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units

Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--SEQID

classVariables.label: Sequence Identifier

Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units

classVariables.label: Published Variant Identifier
classVariables.name: --PVRID
classVariables.notes: A unique identifier for the variation that has been publicly characterized in an external database.

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Original Units
Result or Finding in Standard Format
Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--COPYID

classVariables.label: Copy Identifier
classVariables.name: --COPYID
classVariables.notes: An arbitrary identifier used to differentiate between copies of a genetic target of interest present on homologous chromosomes.

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CHRON

classVariables.label: Chronicity of Finding
classVariables.name: --CHRON
classVariables.notes: Characterization of the duration of a biological process resulting in a particular finding.

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--DISTR

classVariables.label: Distribution Pattern of Finding
classVariables.name: --DISTR
classVariables.notes: Description of the distribution pattern of a finding within the examined area.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--RESLOC

classVariables.definition: Anatomical location where the result was observed.
classVariables.examples: "PINNA" when --LOC is "EAR" \n "LUNG, LEFT LOWER LOBE" where --LOC is "CHEST" \n "CORTEX" when --SPEC is "KIDNEY"
classVariables.label: Result Location of Finding
classVariables.name: --RESLOC
classVariables.notes: Location where the result was observed (as opposed to the location specified for examination). This location may have a higher degree of specificity than the location specified for examination.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--STAT

classVariables.label: Completion Status
classVariables.name: --STAT
classVariables.notes: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--REASND

classVariables.definition: The explanation for why requested information was not available.
classVariables.label: Reason Not Done
classVariables.name: --REASND
classVariables.notes: Used in conjunction with --STAT when value is "NOT DONE".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--XFN

classVariables.definition: The filename and/or path to external data not stored in the same format and possibly not the same location as the other data for a study.
classVariables.examples: A filename and/or path for an ECG waveform or a medical image.
classVariables.label: External File Path
classVariables.name: --XFN

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--NAM

classVariables.definition: The name of the vendor performing an assessment.
classVariables.label: Laboratory/Vendor Name
classVariables.name: --NAM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--LOINC

classVariables.definition: A short sequence of characters used to represent laboratory and clinical tests within the Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC) database.
classVariables.label: LOINC Code
classVariables.name: --LOINC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--SPEC

classVariables.definition: The type of sample material taken from a biological entity.
classVariables.label: Specimen Material Type
classVariables.name: --SPEC

qualifiesVariables.title: Specimen Material Type

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--ANTREG

classVariables.definition: The specific anatomical or biological region of a tissue or organ specimen.
classVariables.examples: A section or part of what is described in the --SPEC variable \n "CORTEX", "MEDULLA", "MUCOSA"
classVariables.label: Anatomical Region
classVariables.name: --ANTREG
classVariables.notes: As defined in the protocol.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--SPCCND

classVariables.definition: The physical state or quality of a sample for assessment.
classVariables.label: Specimen Condition
classVariables.name: --SPCCND

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--SPCUFL

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether a sample is suitable for testing.
classVariables.label: Specimen Usability for the Test
classVariables.name: --SPCUFL
classVariables.notes: The value will be "N" if the specimen is not usable, and null if the specimen is usable.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--LOC

classVariables.label: Location Used for the Measurement
classVariables.name: --LOC
classVariables.notes: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement.

classVariables.label: Laterality
classVariables.name: --LAT
classVariables.notes: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality.

Location Used for the Measurement

classVariables.label: Directionality
classVariables.name: --DIR
classVariables.notes: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality.

Location Used for the Measurement

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--PORTOT

classVariables.label: Portion or Totality
classVariables.name: --PORTOT
classVariables.notes: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement or apportioning of).

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--METHOD

classVariables.label: Method of Test or Examination
classVariables.name: --METHOD
classVariables.notes: Method of the test or examination.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--RUNID

classVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify a particular run of a test on a particular batch of samples.
classVariables.label: Run ID
classVariables.name: --RUNID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--ANMETH

classVariables.label: Analysis Method
classVariables.name: --ANMETH
classVariables.notes: Analysis method applied to obtain a summarized result. Analysis method describes the method of secondary processing applied to a complex observation result (e.g., an image, a genetic sequence).

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--TMTHSN

classVariables.label: Test Method Sensitivity
classVariables.name: --TMTHSN
classVariables.notes: The sensitivity of the test methodology with respect to observation, detection, or quantification.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--LEAD

classVariables.definition: An electrical recording from some region of the body that represents the voltage difference between 2 electrodes.
classVariables.label: Lead Identified to Collect Measurements
classVariables.name: --LEAD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CSTATE

classVariables.definition: The subject's level of consciousness.
classVariables.label: Consciousness State
classVariables.name: --CSTATE

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--LOBXFL

classVariables.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
classVariables.name: --LOBXFL
classVariables.notes: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. Result value is in --STRESC. Should be "Y" or null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--BLFL

classVariables.definition: An indication that the record is the sponsor-defined baseline assessment, used in study data tabulation.
classVariables.label: Baseline Flag
classVariables.name: --BLFL
classVariables.notes: Result value is in --STRESC. Should be "Y" or null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--FAST

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether a subject has abstained from food and liquid for a prescribed amount of time.
classVariables.label: Fasting Status
classVariables.name: --FAST
classVariables.notes: Valid values include "Y", "N", "U", or null if not relevant.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--DRVFL

classVariables.definition: An indication that the measurement or finding is not a collected value but is processed or computed by the sponsor from collected data.
classVariables.examples: The average of other records used as a computed baseline.
classVariables.label: Derived Flag
classVariables.name: --DRVFL
classVariables.notes: Should be "Y" or null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--EVAL

classVariables.definition: The role of the person(s) providing an evaluation, appraisal, or interpretation.
classVariables.label: Evaluator
classVariables.name: --EVAL
classVariables.notes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group).
classVariables.usageRestrictions: Not in QS, FT, and clinical classifications use case of RS

qualifiesVariables.title: Evaluator

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--EVALID

classVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify the evaluator(s).
classVariables.label: Evaluator Identifier
classVariables.name: --EVALID
classVariables.notes: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in --EVAL.
classVariables.usageRestrictions: Not in QS, FT, and clinical classifications use case of RS

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--ACPTFL

classVariables.definition: An indication that a record is the endorsed assessment.
classVariables.label: Accepted Record Flag
classVariables.name: --ACPTFL
classVariables.notes: Expected values can include "Y", "N", or null. This is not intended to be an analysis flag to indicate acceptability for a given analysis.

qualifiesVariables.title: Toxicity Grade

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--TOX

classVariables.definition: The standardized or dictionary-derived name for an untoward event or finding.
classVariables.label: Toxicity
classVariables.name: --TOX
classVariables.notes: Sponsors should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define-XML document.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--TOXGR

classVariables.definition: A categorical classification of the severity of an event or finding, based on a standard scale, used in study data tabulation.
classVariables.examples: A grade from the NCI CTCAE. \n "2"
classVariables.label: Toxicity Grade
classVariables.name: --TOXGR
classVariables.notes: Sponsors should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define-XML document.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--SEV

classVariables.definition: The quality or degree of harm associated with a finding or event, as collected.
classVariables.label: Severity/Intensity
classVariables.name: --SEV

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CLSIG

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether an observation is clinically significant based on judgment.
classVariables.label: Clinically Significant, Collected
classVariables.name: --CLSIG
classVariables.notes: For collected assessments of clinical significance of a result.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--DTHREL

classVariables.definition: An indication that a particular finding is related to the cause of death.
classVariables.label: Relationship to Death
classVariables.name: --DTHREL

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format
Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--LLOQ

classVariables.definition: The lowest threshold for reliably quantifying the amount of substance measured by a specific test, in standardized units.
classVariables.label: Lower Limit of Quantitation
classVariables.name: --LLOQ
classVariables.notes: Units will be those used for --STRESU.

qualifiesVariables.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format
Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--ULOQ

classVariables.definition: The highest threshold for reliably detecting the result of a specific test in standardized units.
classVariables.label: Upper Limit of Quantitation
classVariables.name: --ULOQ
classVariables.notes: Units will be those used for --STRESU.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--REASPF

classVariables.definition: The explanation for why a test, measurement, or assessment is executed.
classVariables.label: Reason Test Performed
classVariables.name: --REASPF

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--EXCLFL

classVariables.definition: An indication that the result is to be excluded from all calculations.
classVariables.label: Exclude from Statistics
classVariables.name: --EXCLFL
classVariables.notes: Expected to be "Y" or null. --EXCLFL should be null when --STAT is "NOT DONE".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--REASEX

classVariables.definition: The explanation for why a result is excluded from all calculations.
classVariables.label: Reason for Exclusion from Statistics
classVariables.name: --REASEX
classVariables.notes: Used in conjunction with --EXCLFL when its value is "Y".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--USCHFL

classVariables.definition: An indication that the performed test or observation was done at a time that was not planned.
classVariables.label: Unscheduled Flag
classVariables.name: --USCHFL
classVariables.notes: If a test or observation was performed based upon a schedule defined in the protocol, this flag should be null. Expected values are "Y" or null. This variable would not be needed when information on planned assessments is provided, such as when the Trial Visits (TV) and Subject Visits (SV) domains are used.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--REPNUM

classVariables.examples: Multiple measurements of blood pressure or multiple analyses of a sample.
classVariables.label: Repetition Number
classVariables.name: --REPNUM
classVariables.notes: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point or within a visit).

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--RSTIND

classVariables.label: Restraint Indicator
classVariables.name: --RSTIND
classVariables.notes: An indicator as to whether the animal was restrained during the observation period. Expected values are "Y" or null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--RSTMOD

classVariables.label: Restraint Mode
classVariables.name: --RSTMOD
classVariables.notes: A description of whether the restraint was physical and/or chemical.

description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, FINDINGS, 2021-09-24)
label: Findings
name: Findings
